person.persName: George Hancock (Wealthy Jefferson County, KY farmer and Virginia state legislator)

body.p: Residence: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky. Born in Botetourt County, Virginia, son of George Hancock and Margaret Strother. George Hancock completed his education at Yale in 1818, then served one term in the Virginia legislature before moving to Jefferson County, Kentucky, where he lived the rest of his life. A farmer, Hancock organized and was first president of the Jefferson County Agricultural and Mechanical Association in 1852. Owned "Hayfield," a large farm three miles southeast of Louisville. Married Eliza Croghan, daughter of Major William Croghan, on September 28, 1819. Re-married Mary Holliday Davidson on December 14, 1834. George Hancock had four siblings: George Hancock, Jr., Mary Hancock (who married General Albert Sidney Johnston), Carolina (Hancock) Preston (who married Confederate General William Preston), and Julia Hancock, who married Governor William Clark, of Missouri. Hancock had no children, but he raised a number of his second wife's nephews, including Josiah Stoddard Johnston.
